availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of William Elliott and Martha Elliot. Married to Anne E. Elliott. Father of Edwin Elliott, Kate Elliott, Nellie E. Elliott, Hattie Elliott, Robert J. Elliott Jr., and Annie Elliott. Admitted to the bar in 1847. Attorney in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Notary Public in Louisville in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 198B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 5, p. 447B.

H. Charles Ulman, Lawyers' Record and Official Register of the United States, (New York: A. S. Barnes & Co., 1872), 526.
